metadata.titel_preek: Three Days That Changed The World

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The cosmic intervention of God through Christ to alter the course of history and human destiny via the three days of Passion, Descent, and Resurrection.

subject.identificatie: The Strong Son of God / Christ
tekstueel_bewijs: He took a lick that was meant for me
He got under a load that I was meant to carry
The strong Son of God shakes himself
steps forth in the morning light

object.identificatie: The alteration of the human condition and the reversal of death's power.
tekstueel_bewijs: my condition was forever altered and changed
cleared the charges stood against me
God had raised Jesus from the dead

ontvanger.identificatie: The Preacher, the Hearer, and 'Man the creature'
tekstueel_bewijs: put the orphan at the father's table
called him or her a child, an heir
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the orphan/slave) of the Subject's action.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (implied) and the Apostolic Witness
tekstueel_bewijs: I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh
I delivered unto you first of all that which I also received
helper.rol_van_god: God is the primary Subject and the Sender; Christ is the active Subject.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that empowers the preaching of the event.

tegenstander.identificatie: Satan, Death, the Grave, and Sin
tekstueel_bewijs: one of the chief achievements of Satan
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but the ontological powers of the Grave and Satan that hold biblical patriarchs and all humanity captive.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The preacher's mandate to proclaim the Resurrection regardless of circumstance.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Preacher
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher's action is a derivative response to the primary act of Christ. The 'Pouvoir' (power) to preach comes from the reality of the Resurrection.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God had raised Jesus from the dead
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I want to talk this evening
we preach the Resurrection only on Easter

voorbeelden: I am not under any warrant to preach any second probation
I want to talk about this
I want to preach what you might call a post-Easter Sunday sermon
I know in some way I have never been able to explain
I do not know the meaning of this cryptic passage
I've got the keys of hell and death
I shall pass through its swelling current

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily grounded in the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of Christ. It focuses on what Christ *can* and *has done*, which then enables the preacher's future 'Pouvoir' to face death.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'chilled' state of the church (~S1) to the reality of the Grave (S2), then through the 'Until' of the second day, arriving at the explosion of the Third Day (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ physically breaking the 'shivering' grave, moving the Receiver from S2 to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Death is described as a 'strong' hold that even Isaiah and Abraham could not escape.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. The 'engine' of the narrative is Christ's action on behalf of a passive and helpless humanity (orphans, slaves, exiles).

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the 'Moral Doctrine' mention
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ showed in his exemplary way how far God would go

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: he took a lick that was meant for me
put the orphan at the father's table, and called him or her a child

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The preacher explicitly mentions the 'moral doctrine' as one theory but concludes it does not 'tell me everything,' opting instead for a substitutionary and ontological victory model.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: These figures are not examples to follow, but captives to be liberated by the Subject (Christ).

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Assurance and hope in the face of mortality.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is an objective historical event (extra nos) that has subjective consequences.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the historical 'Three Days' to the preacher's personal 'testing time' is seamlessly integrated through the actant of the 'Living Christ'.
spanning_punten: The 'Second Day' remains narratively unresolved ('I do not know'), which creates a slight structural gap.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: he took a lick that was meant for me... I've got the keys of hell and death

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the one who 'pours out' the power to witness to the Resurrection.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is a 'load' and a 'charge' that requires a 'Maker' to die.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the Subject of all transformative verbs. The hearer is correctly positioned as the beneficiary of a cosmic victory.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this balance; it avoids the 'Devoir' (Moralism) trap.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The preacher could slightly strengthen the 'Savoir' (Knowledge) of the second day, though the 'mystery' approach is homiletically effective.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: A strong opponent necessitates a Divine Subject.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The current structure (Soteriology → Proclamation) is correct.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented preaching. By keeping Christ as the Subject of the 'Three Days,' the preacher avoids the trap of turning Easter into a 'to-do list' for the congregation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the preacher's use of repetition ('Christ lives!'), Greimasian analysis reveals that the 'power' of the repetition stems from the Subject-Object relationship established in the first half of the sermon.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the meaning of 1 Cor 15; semiotics focuses on how the preacher 'casts' the roles of God and the listener within that meaning.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the preacher's personal testimony of surgery is not 'narcissistic' because the Subject of that sub-narrative remains 'Christ living in me' rather than 'my own courage'.

volledige_subject_lijst: The strong Son of God (shakes himself)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses historical analogies (Wolfe/Montcalm) to establish the 'Sender' (History/Providence) before moving to the 'Primary Program' of Salvation.
